newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU set to clear Coca-Cola buy of British bottler.
newsitem.headline: EU set to clear Coca-Cola buy of British bottler.

text.p: The European Commission appears set to clear Coca-Cola Enterprises Inc.'s full control of British bottler Coca-Cola & Schweppes Beverages Ltd later this month despite strong initial competition concerns.
The deal, which will create a bottling and distribution giant, prompted fears that Atlanta-based Coca-Cola could dominate the British market.

But the Commission's competition services were unable to substantiate such fears and a panel of antitrust experts from the EU's 15 states recommended Tuesday that the proposed acquisition of CCSB be cleared, EU sources said.

At issue was mainly the question of whether the Coca-Cola brand and other cola drinks were a market of their own or whether they were interchangeable with orange-flavored fizzy brands and other carbonated soft drinks.
"The question is 'does Coca-Cola compete with Orangina or is it competing only with Virgin Cola and other cola-flavored products?'" an EU source said.

The Commission's competition directorate took the view that cola-flavored beverages did not compete with other carbonated soft drinks. But it stopped short of concluding that Coca-Cola would gain a dominant position.
"The Commission was not satisfied there were sufficient grounds for believing there was creation of dominance," the EU source said.
Another EU official said: "We knew that argument was shaky and the legal service had doubts of its own."

The Commission has until Jan. 29 to make a final decision. But the ruling may come as early as Jan. 22, the sources said. It must rule by a majority vote on a proposal by European Competition Commissioner Karel Van Miert.

The expected outcome is a major defeat for British tycoon Richard Branson's Virgin Cola, which filed a complaint with the Commission against CCSB accusing it of anti-competitive practices in Britain. Coca-Cola's arch rival Pepsico is also reported to have voiced concerns about the acquisition.

Coca-Cola Enterprises is a major U.S. producer and bottler of beverages owned by the Coca-Cola company. It is acquiring control of CCSB from Cadbury Schweppes through its purchase of Amalgamated Beverages Great Britain Ltd.
Following the agreement with Coca-Cola, Cadbury will no longer bottle and distribute its own brands of soft drinks.

Coca-Cola's purchase of CCSB was submitted to the Commission for clearance in August under the bloc's merger rules. The Commission started a full probe in September, leading to fears that the transaction could be downsized.
The EU must approve all large mergers and acquisitions involving companies that have a European turnover of at least 250 million European currency units ($200 million) each.
